 I haven't personally seen an abortion performed, but I have seen some of the images of aborted fetuses - which is at least a partial experience of abortion. I can understand the gut reaction that people have at seeing the images of the mangled bodies of aborted fetuses. My initial reaction is the same - disgust and sympathy. However, we cannot always trust our gut reactions. After all, when we see pictures of autopsies being performed, we get much the same reaction of disgust and sympathy. With autopsy images, however, most people quickly adjust their gut reaction to accomodate the reality that we know full well that the corpse is not experiencing pain or suffering when it is openned up. So, our initial feeling of sympathy disappears after we use our intellect to realize that our initial gut reaction was wrong.
 
 Where the images of aborted fetuses are concerned, those reactions might well be right for late term fetuses. In late term, fetuses can experience pain and might well have some mental existence. So, it might well be possible that they did suffer during that abortion. However, for early term abortions (which constitute the great majority of abortions), there is no possibility of the fetus experiencing pain. Indeed, there is no mind or mental existence whatsoever - just an empty shell of a developing body with "nobody home". In those instances, images of aborted fetuses (no matter how human they may look) should not justify a feeling of sympathy since there was no suffering that happened, nobody in that body that was aborted. As with autopsies, we need to step back and ask ourselves whether our gut reactions are right.
 
 Just to let you know how all this affects my stance on abortion. Since it is mental existence that I find most important in the very existence of a person with rights, I think that, up to roughly the beginning of the third trimester (when the brain can be developed enough to have some level of mental existence), abortions should be allowed for any reason. After that, one must balance the rights of the mother with the rights of the fetus since the fetus might now have a mental existence - he is a new person that deserves some level of rights. So, I would restrict third trimester abortions to the main exeptions (risk to life or major risk to health, rape, incest, etc.).
